title: Do Iranians hate Greek people? - Quora

response.answer_text: Funnily enough, no, in general Iranians like Greek people. You have to remember we thrashed the Greeks as well (multiple times, you just don't know because you don't like making movies about the times the West lost), and subjected half their country to "the yoke of foreign colonization for over two centuries" as well. Lydia and Ionia were under Persian rule from the time of Cyrus to Alexander. To this day Iranians know Greece as "Yunan" which is Persian for Ionia. As for "they thrashed the Archaemenids", by whose account? The war of 1812 may be a big deal in Canada, and the tale of how Canada is the only country to invade Washington and burn it to the ground is still told over the campfire whilst ice fishing, but how many Americans remember it or care? I assure you that blank stares is what you will get in Iran if you ask people about Thermopylae and Marathon. These things are big deals for the smaller powers, but for the superpowers they're not quite as central to their self-concept. The battles the Greeks won were just bumps in the road on Persia's way to world domination. This was not only the first world-empire, it was the greatest empire that has ever existed: The 5 Most Powerful Empires in History If you ask Iranians about Greeks, you'll get a smile and some comment about the brilliance of Greek philosophers, how the food's almost as good as Persian food, and that the music is so similar :-)

Hahaha not even in the slightest bit. Actually I think in terms of personality, looks and attitudes Greeks are the closest Europeans (together with southern Italians and Spanish) to Iranians. In fact some of my bestest buddies are greek and we get along very well, though occasionally I make fun of how greeks take so much pride in events so unimportant and inconsequential to us. As for hatred; I always ask the same question from greeks. In my opinion it's really greeks who have a more negative view of Iran than vice versa, mostly thanks to Hollywood. From what I understood, Hollywood, as part of a broader propaganda against Iranians, overtly depicts us as uncivilized, uncultured, cruel/barbaric, losers and heavily tattooed and most importantly enemies of culture and specifically western civilization.  I dont like to go too much into depth but it suffices to say that although we didnt invent philosophy or drama, Iranians werent any less sophisticated than greeks, but unfortunately most of our history and books were burnt and ravaged by Arabs (who came to civilize us) and Mongols, so we dont know much. But even Alexander himself was so overwhelmed by Persian traditions he adopted many of them, much to the suspicion of his generals and companions. Basically Persia was the first, the most powerful and the sole superpower of its time (comprising 47% of the thens world population, the highest of all time), and it was essentially expanding its influence, the same way Romans did; but there is this illusion that for some reason Persians were nomadic and bloodthirsty berbers (like Mongols) and Romans were the civil peaceful nice bunch of guys. In fact Persian conquests were really blood-less by today and thens standard (for instance under the first King, Cyrus, when Persians were conquering Babylon and freeing Jews form prisons,  Persian soldiers had a direct decree which forbid them from raping, pillaging, causing panic or hurting civilians; this is well documented in Cyrus cylinder). All in all, I love greeks and although they sometimes bitch about how we were the uncivilized and they were the civilized, I think we are very close in mentality (both very warm people, lazy and tan :D )

NOPE How could I hate people for wars that were over 2000 Years ago? As User-13633305407913321975 said in his answer: Whether Iranians were thrashed or thrashed the Greeks in the past, 2000 years is a very long time for both peoples to live and let live. Also there are many great things Greeks produced from their philosophy, to culture and language that is universally enjoyed regardless of one persons background. To add to his answer, Greeks were not only ones who invaded Iran. The Mongols conquered Iran and wiped out 75–90% of Iran’s population and yet we don’t have any hatred towards Mongolia or Mongolian People. Most probably never think about Mongolia. During World War I, Britain and Russia invaded, occupied, and blockaded Iran and caused a famine that killed around 8–10 Million Iranians, yet we have no hatred towards any individual Brits or Russians. Although some still believe that both countries still owe compensation for the famine. Most Iranians I’m sure do not think much about ancient wars between Greece and Persia. Besides, if I were ever to hate Greek People, I would have to resent this stuff: Delicious Food    Amazing Architecture    Inspiring History  Yes I know these guys fought the Persians, but they are still inspiring Thousands of years of inspiring philosophy  And I would have to hate this guy and everything show he is in.  John Stamos I hope this answers your question.

That wasn't my experience at least. One of my best friends in university was an Iranian guy. We got on extremely well, and I felt welcome with his compatriots. He was also comfortable around my other Greek friends as well. Another Iranian friend (they never knew each other) was also a great guy. I'll never forget when he invited me with another 4 Greek guys to his house over Christmas. His mother actually bought presents for everyone. And no, he wasn't Christian. Recently, I met another Iranian guy while in Dubai. When he heard I was Greek, he actually warmed up and was very friendly. So I have no idea where you got that feeling that Iranians hate Greeks. From my own personal experience, I'd say it's quite the opposite. We share a lot of history together, and I don't recall any particular animosity, although of course there was rivalry.

Alexander ruined Archimedean empire. Yet, in Iran parents name their children ‘Alexander’ or ‘Eskandar’ which is the persian version of ‘Alexander’. As an Iranian I love Greece and Greek people. They’re the most civilised, educated and decent people whom ever invaded Persia and contributed to improving society, culture and economy, unlike other invaders of Persia, whom tore parts of language and culture away rather than contributing anything. Besides Spaniards and Italians, Greek have one of the richest cultures and fascinating history in Europe.

My personal experience is a big NO. Quite the contary is actually the truth. I had an Iranian friend that liked Greeks a lot and considered us to be very close to them. I like the Iranian faces, find them more good looking than other Middle Easterners and that they have very distinct characteristics. Given that Iran had a civilization of centuries prior to the rise of Islam and this functioned as a ‘national’ escape plan to create their national version of Muslim religion to emphasize their seperate identity, I can understand that they have a different outlook of history than other Muslims.

Not even a bit. We do have a negative view over Alexander, but not greeks in general. We even adore them, they were great powers.  If you consider that we had to deal with Genghis Khan, Arab's Invasion and many many others, Alexander may even seem very civil in comparison.  We don't talk much about greeks in general, but we usually talk about them in light of their philosophical heritage and achievements.  :)

Why should we? I personally admire Greek culture and civilization! What happened between our countries dates back to prehistoric era! So why should we nowadays hate eachother? For what happened over 2500 years ago? Most of the Iranians, though, have no idea about Greece; but those who do mostly have either a neutral view or a positive view (Based on their knowledge of Ancient Greek civilization). But No hatred or whatever!

Of course not, I as an Iranian even like Greeks. I’m a big fan of Greece history and mythology since I started reading history untill now and I hope Greece will back to its golden days again. let's restore the Byzantine and Sassanid empires together and this time instead fighting, help and protect each other ;)

Iranians do not hate greek people. What happened between the persians and the greeks was so long ago in history it has become forgotten. Many iranians travel to greece for holiday, and I myself have plenty of friends from Iran and we even have friendly arguments about which empire was better. Iranians have more resentment towards arabs than greeks.

Of course not. I am not denying the conflicts between the two, more than 2 thousand years ago. But Iranians are not like that. On average, we even respect the greek civilization and culture to some extent.
Do Iranians hate Greek people? Not at all.
